notes: This file records manual ground-truth adjustments discovered during Phase 0 review.
It is intended to be applied on top of Patterns.csv-derived expectations (collapsed into the 6 consolidated categories).
Each override should include enough evidence/justification to be auditable.
If a ticket is discovered to be out-of-universe (not present in Full_Ticket_Data_1767638152669.csv), it should be excluded here so it does not affect scoring.
Overrides may optionally include an 'add' list to enrich expected labels when Patterns.csv is incomplete for a ticket.

overrides.rationale: Patterns.csv includes 60098171 under 'Slow Ai/agent responses with gaps measured in days' (RESPONSE_DELAYS), but the fetched ticket_360 interactions for 60098171 are all on 2025-07-08 within a few hours (no multi-day gaps). The AI-wall/looping behavior is present via repeated ATLAS-only handling and customer requests for a live agent in the embedded chat transcript.
evidence_files: IgniteTech_Khoros_GFI - Central Support Issues we see in tickets - Patterns.csv

overrides.rationale: Patterns.csv seeds 60209553 only under AI_QUALITY_FAILURES ('Hermes answers are filler...'), but the ticket_360 timeline shows additional clear patterns: repeated complete-outage escalation and urgent callback requests (P1/SEV1 mishandling), repeated requests for live agent/callback with no immediate real-time engagement (AI wall), a multi-day response gap (Sep 30 -> Oct 3) (response delays), and repeated auto-closure language while the customer explicitly requests the ticket remain open amid unresolved issues (premature-closure signaling).
evidence_files: IgniteTech_Khoros_GFI - Central Support Issues we see in tickets - Patterns.csv

overrides.rationale: Patterns.csv also seeds 60218313 under AI_WALL_LOOPING ('Ai looped requests'), but the ticket_360 timeline shows rapid transition from ATLAS replies (10/10) to multiple human responders (Aditi, Arafat, Raymond, Pablo) and no clear 'AI-only wall' pattern preventing access to a human. We keep only AI_QUALITY_FAILURES as the expected label for this ticket.
